thread.title: Tottenham ready to sell flop Vincent Janssen — before they've even finished paying his transfer fee
thread.title_full: Tottenham ready to sell flop Vincent Janssen — before they've even finished paying his transfer fee

author: John Cross
title: Tottenham ready to sell flop Vincent Janssen — before they've even finished paying his transfer fee
text:
Sport Tottenham ready to sell flop Vincent Janssen — before they've even finished paying his transfer fee The Netherlands striker signed last July in a £20m deal is yet to score from open play in the Premier League Share Spurs can sell Janssen back to Holland without absorbing a big financial hit (Photo: Getty) Share Get     
Tottenham will cut their losses and sell Vincent Janssen this summer. 
Dutch striker Janssen admitted his frustration this week after struggling to adapt to English football. 
The 22-year-old has managed just one goal from open play since a £20million move from AZ Alkmaar in his homeland last summer. 
As Tottenham have yet to pay all the instalments on the deal, Janssen could return to Holland in a transfer that would see them taking only a relatively small financial hit. Janssen's only goal from open play was against third-tier Millwall, who already trailed 4-0 (Photo: REUTERS) 
The Holland international was brought in to provide competition for and back-up to Harry Kane, but has struggled to fit into the Londoners' system. 
Even with Kane injured, manager Mauricio Pochettino has often used attacking midfielder Heung-min Son up front instead, and Janssen’s poor goal record — four of his five have been penalties, and he's still yet to score from open play in the Premier League — will see him offloaded this summer. 
Pochettino will be keen to use the cash to strengthen his squad, as last year’s deals had mixed results — £30m Moussa Sissoko is another heading for the White Hart Lane exit, but fellow midfielder Victor Wanyama has been a huge success.
